Sequence Information.Source: Sequence truncation, fish, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Peptide discovery: K + C-terminal truncation of residues 23-33 of pardaxin 4.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is highly similar (95.45%) toDes-(23 - 33)-pardaxin.Activity: active against E. coli D21 (MIC 3 ug/ml), A. calcoaceticus Ac11 (MIC 3 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC 12.5 uM), S. typhirnuriunz LT2 (MIC 12.5 uM), B. megateriurn Bm11 (MIC 0.75 uM), M. luteus ATCC 9341 (MIC 1.5 uM), and B. subtilis ATCC 6051 (MIC 1.2 uM).
Literature Information.Author: Oren Z, Shai Y.1996
Literature Information.Title: A class of highly potent antibacterial peptides derived from pardaxin, a pore-forming peptide isolated from Moses sole fish Pardachirus marmoratus.
